results.title: Safety with small craft
results.creator_credit: Southern Films and Eric L. Morris
results.brief_description: Outlines commonsense safety rules to be followed on rivers, lakes and the sea by water skiers, fishermen, skin-divers, and yachtsmen. Rules regarding life-jackets, giving way, speed limits, and fuelling procedures are illustrated. Suggests simple precautions to be taken by power boat owners to ensure safety.
results.description: Outlines commonsense safety rules to be followed on rivers, lakes and the sea by water skiers, fishermen, skin-divers, and yachtsmen. results.title: Safety record
results.creator_credit: Roland D. Blake, Glenn Griffin and Sarra
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personal Side of Safety”.
Quotes company records to prove to workers that safety is successful, modern, and popular, and that safety is accomplished by the individual.

results.title: Safety oriented first aid. Unit 4
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional first aid films. Details what to do in casualty management, including removal of hazards, assessment of situation, examining the casualty and administering first aid. Narrated by John Granik.

results.title: Safety oriented first aid. Unit 3
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional first aid films. Head, neck and back injuries - their examination and treatment, and moving the victim if necessary. The causes of burns and scalds, and first aid procedures. First aid for eye injuries, handling and moving casualties, and first aid for victims of poisoning. Narrated by John Granik.

results.title: Safety oriented first aid. Unit 2
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional first aid films. Explains the symptoms of shock, its causes and treatment. Shows fractures and dislocations; how they occur, and their treatment. Narrated by John Granik.

group_works.title: The Lost 600
group_works.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, New South Wales. Dept. of Sport and Recreation and Michael Robertson Film Productions

results.title: Safety in your hands
results.creator_credit: Jill Robb, South Australian Film Corporation and John Fitzgerald
results.brief_description:
This 1974 film examines the responsibility of each worker for their own safety in the workplace. The film focuses particularly on protection of hands and eyes in industrial settings, showing a variety of machines operated by people. It demonstrates how untidiness, inattention, overconfidence and failure to use safety precautions such as safety glasses when operating these machines can lead to accidents. Footage of industrial workplaces is interspersed with footage of everyday accidents similarly caused by mess, distraction and overconfidence.

Produced by the South Australian Film Corporation for the South Australian Department of Labour and Industry.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.
